One of the simplest areas where risk can be reduced is by removing security administration access from the system administration IDs. Security administration is not likely to be a daily task because a system that is established does not need frequent security changes. Also, changes that are needed can often be done automatically by using tools (such as the DirMaint-RACF connector as described in “DirMaint-RACF Connector” on page 321) to mirror directory changes into RACF. Important: It is vital to ensure that IBMVM1 is used only as a modeling template for the setup of administration IDs on your system. IBMVM1 must never be used for someone to log on to the system. Note: Some tasks are sufficiently complex that they must be done by using the supplied ID; for example, z/VM service by using VMSES/E that uses the MAINT720 ID.
